citeinfo.title: TNRCC Surface Water Rights Diversion Points

descript.abstract: This layer contains the point locations of Water Rights Diversions for surface water in Texas.
descript.purpose: General purpose use. To determine locations of Surface Water Rights Diversion Points in Texas. This GIS layer will provide the foundation for future application developments designed to provide a means for TNRCC staff to spatially query Water Rights databases.
descript.supplinf:
This layer is currently certified as a Level One Layer, which means it is not in its final form. Once duplicate or incorrect identification numbers are corrected by the Surface Water Uses Section of the TNRCC, a data table (WRDETAIL) will be joined to the coverage to allow for spatial queries of the database, and to provide supplemental information for each point in the coverage. Approximately 177 points have duplicate id numbers, and 18 points appear to lie in river basins that do not match their id numbers.
For information on Surface Water Rights in Texas, refer to: http://www.tnrcc.state.tx.us/water/quantity/wateruses/surface.html

status.update: Once duplicate or incorrect identification numbers are corrected, a data table (WRDETAIL) will be joined to the coverage to allow for spatial queries of the database. After that, updates and revisions will be made as needed.

idinfo.useconst: None. Acknowledgement of the Texas Natural Resource Conservation Commission would be appreciated in products derived from this dataset.

browse.browsed: The graphic displays Surface Water Rights Diversion Points for the State of Texas.

idinfo.datacred: Surface Water Uses Section of the Agriculture & Watershed Management Division, Office of Water Resource Management, TNRCC.

attracc.attraccr: In many cases, the first two digits of the Facility Identification Number (FID), which indicate the TNRCC basin number, do not correspond with the basin in which they are located. Also, approximately 177 points were found to have duplicate ID numbers. For additional information concerning these errors, refer to both the Supplemental Section and the Attribute Definition for BASIN.

dataqual.complete: With the exception of the WRDETAIL database (to be added later), nothing was found missing in this layer.

horizpa.horizpar: During the digitizing phase, a total of eight control points or "tics" were used to ensure that the map was registered accurately. During registration of the map, the maximum error allowed was 25 meters. The average error was approximately 20 meters. The five tics with the lowest RMS error were used when projecting the layer.

qhorizpa.horizpae: Spatial error in this layer is attributed to inaccuracies on the source maps due to "age" and "printing errors".

srcinfo.srccontr: All data in this spatial dataset was digitized from mylar county maps containing diversion points added by the Surface Water Uses Section and from the the TNRCC River Basins layer.

procstep.procdesc: Mylar county maps already containing diversion points placed by the Surface Water Uses Section were digitized in Arc/Info using a manual digitizing tablet. Each point was then assigned a Facility Identifiction Number (FID) which is a concatenation of the TNRCC Basin Number and the Stream Order Number. The latitude and longitude for each point was calculated from the geo-referenced coverage and then placed into the attribute table. All of the coverages (which were digitized separately by county) were then appended into a single statewide coverage. Finally, the coverage was projected into TSMS.

lambertc.fnorth: 1,000,000 meters 4.1.2.1.3 Other_Projection's_Defintion: The projection system used corresponds to the Texas State-wide Mapping System (TSMS) defined in the Texas GIS Planning Council's GIS Data Standards. TSMS uses measurement units of meters.

attr.attrdef: field uniquely identifies each diversion point.

TNRCC RIVER BASIN NUMBER. This two-digit numeric field is identical to the basin numbers found in the TNRCC River Basins layer. It was determined by overlaying the diversion points with the TNRCC River Basins layer using GIS software.
NOTE: Some water rights diversion points overlie river basins that are not the same as the basin number shown in WRDETAIL (which are the first two digits of the FID number).
Most of these points are close to the boundary between the two indicated basins. In these cases, the discrepancy may be caused by errors in the lat/long from WRDETAIL, or by errors in the River Basins map layer.
However, some points (those indicated with an asterisk) are well removed from the basin indicated by WRDETAIL. These points either have a large error in lat/long, or they have been assigned the wrong basin number.
GIS WRDETAIL GIS FACILITY ID NUMBER BASIN BASIN (WRDETAIL BASIN + RIVER ORDER) ===== ======== ============================== 18 19 195660000000 17 18 180200400000 17 18 180199900000 17 18 180200000000 17 18 180200100000 17 18 180200200000 17 18 180200300000 11 12 120400000000 * 4 5 057061200000 6 8 082110150000 8 12 120756750000 21 6 062633330000 * 21 19 191700000000 12 14 142179870000 2 8 088203000000 7 6 060200000000 20 21 216851000000 * 5 6 069052570000

FACILITY IDENTIFICATION NUMBER. This twelve-digit numeric field assigned by TNRCC indicates the basin and stream order number for each diversion point. The first two digits indicate the basin number and the last 10 digits identify the stream order number.
LATITUDE. This eleven-digit numeric field indicates the latitude of each diversion point in decimal degrees.
LONGITUDE. This thirteen-digit numeric field indicates the longitude of each diversion point in decimal degrees.
This 15-character field indicates the name of the county containing the diversion point.

attrdomv.udom: Random values that do not lend themselves to range typing or enumerating or codesets.

attr.attrdef: This 2-digit numeric field indicates the basin number that appears in the WRDETAIL database. This number also correspondes to the first two digits of the FID number. As indicated under the Attribute Definition for BASIN, a few of these FID-BASIN numbers have been found to be in error.

distinfo.distliab: Although these data have been processed successfully on a computer system at the Texas Natural Resource Conservation Commission, no warranty expressed or implied is made by the TNRCC regarding the utility of the data on any other system, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty.
